paragraph.paragraph:
A cluster folder's properties are accessible from the Visual Studio .NET ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfPropertyBrowser.htmproperties window. To view the properties window:
Select a cluster folder in your EiffelEnvision ../../../structure/project.xmlProject.
Choose View, Properties menu. The properties window may also been shown for any selected item by pressing the F4 keyboard shortcut or by choosing Properties from a cluster folder's context menu.

Excluded From Build
Indicates if the cluster folder and all contained Eiffel class and cluster folders should be excluded from compilation. Note: This property is read-only when the cluster folder has not been excluded explicitly, but has been excluded because a parent ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/cluster_folders.xmlCluster Folder has been excluded from a ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder. Note: This property will also be read-only when a parent ../../../structure/project_items/clusters_and_items/explicit_clusters.xmlExplicit Cluster Folder's clusters.xmlcluster_libraryCluster Library Cluster property is set to Yes, because changes are ignored by the Eiffel for .NET compiler for library marked clusters.

Folder Name
The name of the cluster folder, the same as in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htmSolution Explorer window. Changing this property will rename the corresponding folder on disk.

Folder Path
The full path to the corresponding folder on disk

Cluster Namespace
The namespace that will be used to qualify all contained Eiffel ../../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclasses. This property is based on the ../general.xmlcluster_namespace_formatCluster Namespace Format project configuration property and it's casing determined by the ../general.xmldotnet_naming_convention.NET naming convention project configuration property.
